drivers: Steep ramp of AMD Instinct™ GPU shipments
Adoption of AMD Instinct™ GPUs by cloud and enterprise customers

MI300X.impact: Accelerated AI deployments across multiple platforms

Strong growth in EPYC CPU sales

EPYC_4th_Gen.impact: Increased adoption in enterprise and cloud environments

drivers: Strong demand for AMD Ryzen™ processors
Initial shipments of next-generation Zen 5 processors

ryzen_8000_series.impact: Growth in notebook and desktop CPU sales

zen_5.impact: Leadership in performance and energy efficiency

gaming.context: Includes discrete graphics processors and semi-custom game console products

drivers: Decrease in semi-custom revenue due to console cycle

so_c_sales.impact: Decline due to being in the fifth year of the console cycle

embedded.context: Includes embedded products and adaptive computing solutions

versal_gen_two.description: Versal™ Premium VP1902 Adaptive SoC Gen Two
versal_gen_two.performance_improvement: 3x increase in AI TOPS per watt
versal_gen_two.impact: Enhanced AI capabilities across a broad range of products

spartan_ultrascale.performance_improvement: High IO counts and power efficiency

total_expenses.context: Operating expenses including R&D, marketing, amortization of intangible assets, and acquisition-related costs
key_factors: Increased investments in R&D to support AI growth opportunities
Higher operating expenses to scale the business

R&D.context: Increased investments in research and development to support product roadmaps and AI initiatives

marketing.context: Enhanced go-to-market activities to support product launches and growth initiatives

amortization.context: Amortization of intangible assets associated with acquisitions

acquisition_related_costs.context: Costs related to strategic acquisitions, including Silo AI, Mipsology, and Nod.ai

drivers: Higher revenue in Data Center and Client segments

eps.context: Diluted earnings per share for Q2 2024
eps.notes: Includes better-than-expected revenue and operating expenses

non_gaap_eps.context: Non-GAAP diluted earnings per share for Q2 2024

tax_rate.context: Effective tax rate for Q2 2024 and full year 2024

free_cash_flow.notes: Includes strategic investments and stock repurchases

cash_from_operations.notes: Reflects strong financial model despite mixed demand environment

share_repurchase.context: Repurchased $352 million of common stock during Q2 2024

third_quarter_2024.additional_notes: Expect to close the acquisition of Silo AI for approximately $665 million in cash during Q3 2024.

full_year_2024.revenue_growth_year_over_year: Expected based on roadmaps and strategic priorities
full_year_2024.context: Led by growth in Embedded and Data Center segments

partnerships_and_adoptions: Microsoft adopting Instinct MI300X for GPT-4 Turbo and Copilot services
Meta deploying MI300 in AI workloads
Oracle deploying MI300 for database solutions
Subaru adopting Versal™ Premium VP1902 for EyeSight ADAS system
Stable Diffusion partnering to support SD 3.0 on MI300
Hugging Face supporting Llama 3.1 on MI300X
Broadcom, Cisco, HP Enterprise, Intel, Google, Meta, and Microsoft collaborating on Ultra Accelerator Link
ecosystem_support: Enhanced support for OpenAI Triton compiler
Collaborations with major AI software and cloud providers
Day 1 support for AMD hardware in new AI models and frameworks
corporate_responsibility: Investments in sustainable technological and scientific advancements
Support for community initiatives amidst COVID-19

operating_environment_challenges: Substantial inventory reduction across the PC supply chain

executive_comments.ceo_statement: “We delivered strong revenue and earnings growth in the second quarter driven by record Data Center segment revenue,” said AMD Chair and CEO Dr. Lisa Su. “Our AI business continued accelerating and we are well positioned to deliver strong revenue growth in the second half of the year led by demand for Instinct, EPYC and Ryzen processors. The rapid advances in generative AI are driving demand for more compute in every market, creating significant growth opportunities as we deliver leadership AI solutions across our business.”
executive_comments.cfo_statement: “AMD executed well in the second quarter, with revenue above the midpoint of our guidance driven by strong growth in the Data Center and Client segments,” said AMD EVP, CFO and Treasurer Jean Hu. “In addition, we expanded gross margin and delivered solid earnings growth, while increasing our strategic AI investments to build the foundation for future growth.”
